title: SK hynix completes development of next-gen HBM4 — 2,048-bit interface and 10 GT/s speeds promised for next-gen AI accelerators
summary: SK hynix has finalized development of its HBM4 memory stacks with a 2,048-bit interface and 10 GT/s speed, 25% above JEDEC specs.

title: Borderlands 4 on PC crushing even the most powerful rigs — RTX 5090 struggles in some scenarios, but day one patch solves plenty of issues
summary: Borderlands 4 has arrived on PC to a chorus of criticism over performance and stuttering. Early reports from players described low frame rates and frequent crashes, even on high-end hardware.

title: Seagate's humongous 28TB HDD is a massive deal for a limited time at just $11.75 per TB — Desktop Expansion HDD on sale at Best Buy for $329
summary: A massive 28TB backup solution for your desktop setup. Seagate's Expansion HDD is $329 in a limited-time Best Buy sale.

title: Amazon says bug caused select Echo Show devices to use tons of data — widgets caching large images caused gigabytes of internet usage
summary: Amazon says that a bug in a widget on select Echo Show devices caused them to cache high-resolution images and use up a ton of data.

title: Nintendo Switch 2 mod adds over an hour of playtime with bigger 8,000mAh battery — unofficial replacement battery packs sell for as little as $40
summary: Testing shows Cyberpunk 2077 running over an hour longer after the upgrade

title: Netgear Orbi 370 Wi-Fi 7 mesh router review: Dual-band Wi-Fi 7 hardware finally makes Orbi affordable
summary: With a much lower price point compared to its Orbi siblings, the Orbi 370 looks to tackle the entry-level Wi-Fi 7 market.

title: The new frontier: Meet the power players cashing in on the AI gold rush
summary: Many of the world's richest people are the founders and CEOs of the top tech firms cashing in on the big AI boom, with some particular standouts "earning" tens of billions of dollars in a single day.

title: Intel Xeon chief architect leaves just 8 months after appointment — Ronak Singhal latest departure in ongoing shakeup
summary: Ronak Singhal, Intel Xeon chief architect, departs from the company just eight months after his appointment and after 28 years at the company.

title: Nvidia and Kioxia target 100 million IOPS SSD in 2027 —  AI server drives aim to deliver 33 times more performance
summary: Kioxia is working with Nvidia to develop a 100 million IOPS SSD for AI servers by 2027, likely leveraging unconventional NAND architectures.

title: Centimetre by centimetre - how Duplantis became a world star
summary: Armand Duplantis is a global star of athletics, but what makes the Swede so great - and where could he take the pole vault world record?

title: MSI Afterburner developer adding 'triple channel voltage' support for future MSI RTX 50 graphics cards
summary: MSI Afterburner's developer announced he is implementing support for triple-channel voltage controls in the application, allowing users with compatible GPUs to manipulate memory and auxiliary voltage.

title: Intel's 14nm+++ desktop CPUs are making a comeback — chipmaker inexplicably resurrects Comet Lake from five years ago with 'new' Core i5-110
summary: Intel has launched the Core i5-110, a six-core, 12-thread Comet Lake processor with a $200 MSRP.

title: Lexar NM1090 Pro 4TB SSD Review: A 'Budget' High-End Drive
summary: The Lexar NM1090 Pro is not a bad drive, but its appeal is somewhat limited given its position in the market. It has good all-around performance, but it isn't exceptional.

title: DOOM multiplayer tribute gets coded in 'pure SQL' and runs at 30FPS — made from just 150 lines of code in less than a month
summary: A computer scientist used only 'pure SQL' to construct a multiplayer DOOM-like game that runs at 30 FPS.

title: Top China silicon figure calls on country to stop using Nvidia GPUs for AI — says current AI development model could become 'lethal' if not addressed
summary: VP of China SIA Wei Shaojun urged China and other Asian nations to abandon reliance on Nvidia GPUs for AI and instead develop dedicated processors for LLM training to ensure long-term technological independence.

title: Windows 11 25H2 ISOs released after delays — upgrade switches on some features, now available for insiders
summary: Microsoft has released ISO install media for Windows 11 version 25H2, the next feature update in its annual release cycle. As of September 10, official ISOs are available via the Windows Insider download page.

title: Taiwan increases defensive patrols around 24 undersea cables — closely monitoring '96 blacklisted China-linked boats' with 24-hour operations
summary: Taiwan has intensified patrols around the 24 undersea cables that connect it with the global internet.

title: Researchers develop modified glue gun that can print bone — device 3D prints synthetic grafts directly onto patients’ living tissue during surgery
summary: A research team modified a hot glue gun for use in orthopedic surgery, allowing for faster bone healing.

title: OpenAI signs contract to buy $300 billion worth of Oracle computing power over the next five years — company needs 4.5 gigawatts of power, enough to power four million homes
summary: OpenAI and Oracle have signed one of the largest technology deals in history, worth $300 billion. Over five years starting in 2027, Oracle will provide OpenAI with over 4.5 gigawatts worth of computing power to help power ChatGPT and other AI products and services.

title: ASRock X870 Nova WiFi Motherboard Review: Lots of storage, not without sacrifice
summary: ASRock’s X870 Nova offers users a good balance between the more expensive X870E and lower-end B850 Chipsets. But take a close look at how bandwidth is shared if you plan to use a lot of M.2-based storage.

title: Nano11 compresses Windows 11 install footprint to as little as 2.8GB — 'extreme experimental script' is 3.5 times smaller than Tiny11 and comes with 'none of the fluff'
summary: Nano11 Builder for Windows 11 produces the smallest Windows 11 installer ISOs and finished installation sizes yet.

title: How Hodgkinson found strength in 'most challenging year'
summary: Britain's Keely Hodgkinson aims to add the world 800m title to her Olympic gold in Tokyo.

title: Humble & sweet, but a lion - the story of the first female £1m player
summary: Meet the person behind women's football's first £1m player, Arsenal's new superstar forward Olivia Smith.

title: 'People looked at me like I was a something, not someone'
summary: In a candid interview, World Cup winner Heather Fisher discusses losing her hair and the struggle she had with her identity.

title: 'He fixes what needs fixing' - why Raducanu turned to Nadal's ex-coach
summary: Emma Raducanu recently appointed another full-time coach in Spaniard Francisco Roig - BBC Sport speaks to those who know him best.

title: 'He has made young players dream' - the making of Liverpool icon Salah
summary: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

title: Becky Zerlentes - the first female boxer to die in fight in US
summary: The story of Becky Zerlentes - the first female boxer to die in a sanctioned fight in the United States.

title: How Hampton overcame odds to become England's number one
summary: Hannah Hampton on overcoming a serious eye condition to rise to become England's number one goalkeeper at Euro 2025.

title: Lucy Bronze - the making of England's most decorated player
summary: This is the story of England defender Lucy Bronze, who is no stranger to winning and hopes for more success at Euro 2025.
